c20c1e0b42fa9b34e229b913f5ee8d72d62dcd5c;2014-11-14 07:12:24 -0500;Various reviewer/editor type changes to the user guide.  The changes include correcting some spelling and grammar mistakes.  Other changes include standardizing on a single form of a word. Examples include i.e., BPMN, LDAP, JUnit, JSON, and JavaScript. I either selected the common industry usage or the most prevalent usage in the document.  Thus 'i.e.' was selected over 'ie.'.  In other cases where the usage was large and split almost evenly I left them alone.  Such an example is 'eg.' vs. 'e.g.'.

732d9eee3c1c574949051357a04351fa97b2d1f3;2015-06-01 20:14:24 +0200;Fixing deletes for Mysql: all dbs except for Mysql seem to be able to cope with bulk deletes. So when the db is MySql, we'll switch to a layered delete of the execution tree (children per level before parent) instead of one big delete. This commit is the first approach, removing the bulk delete for Mysql, but not yet layered.
3c071d7c9b2bcb5c556816b141ea46e0ae5dd6cd;2015-06-02 12:06:46 +0200;Found a way to have bulk deletes on Mysql too: using an 'on delete cascade' in the FK definition. However, this does mean, the optimistic locking check for bulk deletes can't be used anymore (as the cascade deletes won't be returned in the number of deleted row). Then again, optimistic locking for deletes made very little sense too, as a delete typically needs to go through, irregardless of of an update happening.
fa2e259361332e2f7aec6ff1bbd7d9102a4a3dd7;2015-06-02 15:18:12 +0200;Fix ExclusiveServiceConcurrent test, deadlock can happen on Mysql in rare cases (but this is to be expected), but should be handled correctly.

b80e89a1767a789984df69ad7075e1a26f7f288e;2015-11-11 00:39:20 +0100;Multi instance refactoring: introduced the 'IS_MI_ROOT_' column to indicate an execution is the root of a multi instance. Every multi instance (sequential and parallel, parallel already had it) will now spawn an execution that acts as parent for the whole multi instance. This has two benefits: cleanup becomes way easier and it opens up the possibility to dynamically add new instances to a multi instance (not yet implemented).

The use case is similar to the default process started/ended and activity started/completed, but used the Historic entities which adds additional data (startUserId, duration, etc.). Also fixed the historic activity instance creation for subprocess start events (were missing + had incorrect end time).

08049d984fbf446eb5babb74f34f8b3245e63653;2016-01-23 17:32:16 +0100;Fixes a bug in the DefaultAsyncExecutor when the job queue is full, which fixes performance stalling in high concurrency situations.
0471c05e2442d981e121e7544064a830a0ba5881;2016-01-24 11:41:44 +0100;Added a new async executor setting 'defaultQueueSizeFullWaitTime' setting. This setting will be used when jobs are acquired, but the job queue was full. In this case the job acquisition threads will wait for the amount of time in this setting before doing the query again, giving the queue a bit of a pause. By default set to 0, as to be compatible with the old behaviour.

cc14630f18bf8bd5e960308302a1aac1d0a13b4b;2016-01-28 19:43:58 +0100;Async executor improvement: before, when executing an exclusive job and when not able to get the lock, the executing thread would be stalled for an amount of time and the locking would be retried until the process instance can be locked. This is now changed to not wait+retry, but 'release' the job again (similar to the 'queue full' behavior), thus making the executing thread free again.

b8fd0959afe123aec950ef8466c1d302a5ef1c41;2016-07-06 13:17:15 +0200;Refactoring of DbSqlSession with some major changes: - The deleteOperations are no more. Now, the deleted objects are kept in a map, consistent with the inserted object. This removes the need for looping over all deleteOperations in quite a few places. - The ordering of executions before the insert/delete flush has been removed, the logic inserts/delete always in the correct order and there is no need for extra housekeeping anymore. - Flushing has become more consistent, for inserts/deletes/updates - No need for calling cache remove anymore
